title: "The Expanding Perception of Time and Creativity"
first_phrase: This final section explores the concept of expanded time and its relationship with creativity. The author reflects on how our minds create a linear sense of time for survival, as explained by philosopher Henri Bergson. However, in certain states, we can experience time differently and tap into a different dimension. The author argues that creativity is a manifestation of an eternal, timeless world that we glimpse into. The section concludes by discussing how imagination can operate on the body and how staying in the present can open up possibilities for creativity.
content: “La scoperta è un processo nel quale certe manifestazioni del comportamento della natura “entrano” nel flusso del tempo da un mondo eterno ed esterno” (B. Russel – Mysticism and Logic). L’immaginazione che opera sul corpo Se rimaniamo nel presente, ogni immaginazione diviene l’equivalente di una realtà. Nella realtà dell’ora tutto è possibile. E’ l’ego che blocca le possibilità ed impedisce che le cose si facciano da sole.
last_phrase: In conclusion, by being present in the moment, we can allow possibilities to manifest, operate directly on our body, and suggest new ways of being. However, our ego's resonance can limit our ability to digest new experiences fully, leading to restrictions in our lives. Therefore, accepting and being present allows us to digest experiences and expand our consciousness towards the elixir of life.
